qas.question: What year did Russia decide to never turn its clocks back?
What country other than Russia declared they'd stay in DST all year?
Was Russia or Belarus first in their declaration?
Which season's dark mornings led to people complaining about the switch from DST?
What year did Russia give up on the all-year DST and go back to Standard Time?

context: The <a0_0>2011<a0_0/> declaration by <a2_0>Russia<a2_0/> that it would not turn its clocks back and stay in DST all year long was subsequently followed by a similar declaration from <a1_0>Belarus<a1_0/>. The plan generated widespread complaints due to the dark of <a3_0>winter<a3_0/>time morning, and thus was abandoned in <a4_0>2014<a4_0/>. The country changed its clocks to Standard Time on 26 October 2014 - and intends to stay there permanently.
